page.title: 10WHITE CLEVES QUARRY
page.content: As we approached the quarry we were almost sprayed by an old converted fire-engine.The fire engine's job is to keep the dust down, to please the local inhabitants of that area.The{ {quarry}was opened in{1922}by the Devon County Council.It is now owned by a private company called the{ARC. } Before the Devon County Council bought it,it was called West Mill Farm.The rock they blast out from the{quarry} face is{basalt granite}.The rocks are made into{chippings}and dust.This is done in stages:when the rock has been blasted it is taken to the primary crusher here it is crushed into fragments six inches across.Then it is passed into the secondary crusher where the rock is broken up into pieces about three inches across.Then finally the rock goes into the{ {Hydrocone}where other sizes are made.
